content: kiss and shell by wendee shulsen of hazel knits this stylish kerchief is meant to be a little looser around the neck while the cowl-style keeps it from slipping off your shoulders when knit in assigned pooling yarns the placement of the pattern stitch is mostly determined by the color pops in the yarn which creates that just one more row excitement please read over all pattern notes before beginning materials yarn 1 hank hazel knits lively dk 275 yards sample color rose garden needles us 6 4 0mm 24 circular crochet hook optional 4 0 mm or larger tape measure wet blocking tools pins a surface to pin to tapestry needle gauge 18 stitches = 4 in garter stitch gauge is not critical however changes in gauge will affect yarn yardage and size kiss and shell by wendee shulsen www hazelknits com - pattern questions wendee@hazelknits com page 1 pattern notes abbreviations kiss and shell is worked up in simple garter stitch with a rs - right side unique shell dip stitch pattern that is worked in when the ws - wrong side yarn changes color sequence the side edges include a sts - stitches built-in i-cord for a finished look yo - yarn over k - knit the yarn used in kiss and shell is dyed with a long stretch of p - purl main color pale blue and a smaller contrasting burst of skp - slip1stitch knitwise knit the next stitch color green/berry throughout the pattern the pale blue will be referred to as mc and the bright color pop will be pass slipped stitch over decrease 1 stitch referred to as cc slip 3 sts purl-wise wyif - this is an i-cord edging you will place a shell dip referred to as shell throughout knit to the last 3 stitches on left needle bring yarn to pattern when the yarn color transitions from the mc to the front of work between your needles and slip last 3 cc with the rose garden color i knit most of the green stitches purl-wise with yarn in front turn work and resume then began the shell in the berry color the length of the color stretches and the colors within the color stretches are not exactly uniform so some of my shells have more green - yours may as well you may end up knitting the shell on every right side row however you might find the placement too close to the shell on the previous row in this case skip the shell and knit the cc straight through if the cc is working up on the wrong side you may end up skipping one or more row before you make your next shell that s okay you can even make a shell in the mc to shake things up the cc will wander through the project so add your shell stitches whenever they fit on the right side if making a shell near the end of a row
